relationships.evidence_text: John Liu is an ecologist, soil scientist, filmmaker and the visionary behind the ecosystem restoration camps movement.

relationships.evidence_text: I've been making these films about restoration for years and decades.
I made a few essays you can find one called ecosystem. I think the earth repair piece camps in the Permaculture magazine.
there was another one in Cosmos Journal.
I also started writing on social media about it.
when a thousand people agreed to share 10 euros per month.
we said, well, okay, if a thousand people are going to share 120 euros per year, then we'll have to create a foundation.
we created a foundation to accept that money.
the first camp was built in Spain.
you can go learn about it at ecosystemrestorationcamps.org where this is documented.
now there are two foundations, one in Europe and one in North America, in the United States.
the first camp in Spain.
the second camp in the next year was in Mexico.
in the third year, there were 21 camps.
in the fourth year, there are 37 camps around the world in six continents.
this is the beginning of a really big movement, which engages a large number of people.
who might not necessarily be involved in ecological restoration.
we're already seeing exponential growth.
could we end up with millions of people in very many camps all over the world?
people are happily working on soil fertility and working on propagation and planting out and on watershed management.
the dream is coming true.

people are happy, just like the dream. The dream is coming true.

the local communities were engaged in destructive practices.
they had to change these practices.
when the people were cutting the trees then the forest would be lost.

they banned slope farming.
they banned free-ranging of goats and sheep.
we're going to have to replace those with positive developments.
